author: Gregor Kiczales
title: Egg starter- place-egg function
question:
Hi, currently working through the starter and came across a question:

place-egg is a helper for render-eggs. 
in the solution file, place-egg is suppose to rotate AND place the egg on MTS.

Given the rule that one function should only do one thing, why the purpose for place-egg different. I can see that the 2 steps are simple to write. Maybe I’m missing something. 

Compare the 2019 midterm w1, the last question uses a helper: paddle in the initial helper. How is that different in the YOSHI egg program.
instructor_answer:
Great question.
We could have made a helper called rotate-egg, but note that the job of place-egg is to render onto it's image argument an egg described by it's egg argument.  The egg includes x, y, and r, so it makes reasonable sense for place-egg to take care of all 3.
Good eye for picking out the padding helper from 2019w1-mt1.  But that function is a separate helper for a reason we will cover the end of this week.  It is given a natural number n and must produce a string of that many spaces -- so it must consume an arbitrary sized number and do something that number of times.  That requires a separate function.  Again, we will cover that later this week.
